item.title: AFF Suzuki Cup: Malaysia now have to contend with the “Elephants” den - The Sun Daily
item.description:
AFF Suzuki Cup: Malaysia now have to contend with the “Elephants” den  The Sun Daily

KUALA LUMPUR: Despite playing before a packed home crowd, Malaysia were unable to make headway against Thailand in their AFF Suzuki CUP semifinals ...

SEPANG: The national football team will get a massive morale boost in their crucial second leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final match against Thailand thanks ...

item.title: Malaysia moves up 2 rungs in world FIFA rankings - Free Malaysia Today
item.description:
Malaysia moves up 2 rungs in world FIFA rankings  Free Malaysia Today

KUALA LUMPUR: The national football squad have continued their improvement, climbing up two rungs to 167th in the World FIFA rankings for November.

item.title: Substandard field greets Malaysia on first day training - Goal.com
item.description:
Substandard field greets Malaysia on first day training  Goal.com

It wasn't the perfect preparation for Tan Cheng Hoe and his team after arrangements for first day of training designed to hamper team.

item.title: Football: National team must carve out a must-win plan in Myanmar tie - The Star Online
item.description:
Football: National team must carve out a must-win plan in Myanmar tie  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: It's back to the drawing board for the national football team following their 2-0 loss to Vietnam in the AFF Suzuki Cup.

item.title: PM wants to see Harimau Malaya at Fifa World Cup - Malay Mail
item.description:
PM wants to see Harimau Malaya at Fifa World Cup  Malay Mail

KUALA LUMPUR, Dec 7 — Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad expressed hope today that Malaysia could one day compete in the Fifa World Cup, after the national ...

item.title: Football: Dr Mahathir's best wishes to Harimau Malaya team get surprising feedback - The Star Online
item.description:
Football: Dr Mahathir's best wishes to Harimau Malaya team get surprising feedback  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad's best wishes to the national football team have gained interest from his followers - with ...

item.title: Don't let me and the country down, Dr M tells Harimau Malaya - Malaysiakini
item.description:
Malaysiakini

“Don’t let me and the country down.” That was the loud and clear message from Prime Minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad to the national football team ahead of their AFF Suzuki Cup final first-leg tie against Vietnam at the National Stadium, Bukit Jalil, on Dec 11. Mahathir, who will watch the final at the stadium, met the Harimau Malaya squad at Perdana Putra in Putrajaya today in a bid to spur them on. “We must win so that we can be proud of the country’s ability. As Malaysians, we are responsible for defending the dignity and honour of the country,” he said, adding that he hoped the team would d...

item.title: Keeper Farizal out to settle the score with Vietnam - The Star Online
item.description:
Keeper Farizal out to settle the score with Vietnam  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Malaysia goalkeeper Farizal Marlias will have his hands full as the Harimau Malaya brace for Vietnam in the AFF Suzuki Cup final. For Tan Cheng Hoe’s men, it’s a matter of vengeance and redemption – Malaysia lost their their penultimate Group A meeting with Vietnam’s Golden Dragons 2-0, despite being the dominant side in Hanoi on Nov 16. The first leg of the final will be at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil on Dec 11 and the second leg at the My Dinh Stadium in Hanoi on Dec 15. A fired-up Farizal is out to catch the eye and go the extra mile to ensure Malaysia settle the s...

item.title: Players more focused on winning Cup than rewards, says Hamidin - The Star Online
item.description:
Players more focused on winning Cup than rewards, says Hamidin  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Football Association of Malaysia (FAM) president Datuk Hamidin Amin said financial rewards are not on the Malaysian players’ minds as they prepare for the AFF Suzuki Cup final against Vietnam. Coach Tan Cheng Hoe’s men take on favourites Vietnam in the two-leg final after knocking out defending champions Thailand on away goals in the semi-final which ended 2-2 on aggregate in Bangkok on Wednesday. The first leg will be held at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil on Dec 11 and the second leg at the My Dinh Stadium in Hanoi on Dec 15. Hamidin said rewards will take a back seat ...

item.title: Cup final a huge test for Harimau Malaya, says Cheng Hoe - The Star Online
item.description:
Cup final a huge test for Harimau Malaya, says Cheng Hoe  The Star Online

BANGKOK: Malaysia coach Tan Cheng Hoe (pic) reckons that taking the next step and winning the AFF Suzuki Cup will be another huge test for his side. The 10-men Harimau Malaya advanced to the final on away goals after holding defending champions Thailand 2-2 on aggregate in the second leg semi-final on Wednesday. “The players and the team are improving in everything. You can see they’re progressing together. In the final, we play at home first. We need to take our chances there and we need to keep playing the way we’ve been playing and keep up the good momentum,” said Cheng Hoe in the post-m...

item.title: AFF Suzuki Cup ticket sales to start on Friday (Dec 7) - The Star Online
item.description:
AFF Suzuki Cup ticket sales to start on Friday (Dec 7)  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Malaysian fans will be able to purchase tickets for the first leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup final online on Friday (Dec 7). Football Association of Malaysia (FAM) announced that fans will be able to purchase tickets online through www.tickethotline.com.my on Friday and Saturday (Dec 7 and 8). Ticket sales will start at 9am. About 40,000 tickets will be sold online, in which 20,000 will be sold on Friday, and another 20,000 on Saturday. The open stand ticket will cost RM40, while grandstand is priced at RM50. Children will only be charged RM5. Another 40,000 tickets will be sold o...

item.title: Mission possible - The Star Online
item.description:
Mission possible  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: National team coach Tan Cheng Hoe is in a buoyant mood ahead of the second leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final against Thailand at the Rajamangala Stadium in Bangkok tonight. Cheng Hoe said his men can spring an upset if they can maintain the momentum from the first leg and they need to make their chances count. The 50-year-old coach added that he will have a late fitness test ahead of the match as a few of his players picked up injuries in the first leg. “The players are in good mood. I believe if we continue to play the way we have, we can upset Thailand in this away game,...

item.title: Malaysia in AFF Suzuki Cup final after defeating Thailand on away goals - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia in AFF Suzuki Cup final after defeating Thailand on away goals  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Malaysia is in the final of the AFF Suzuki Cup! Harimau Malaya, led by coach Tan Cheng Hoe, fought back to hold Thailand to a 2-2 draw in a pulsating affair at the Rajamangala Stadium in Bangkok on Wednesday (Dec 5). Malaysia were held 0-0 at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil on Dec 1. Malaysia's goals were scored by Syahmi Safari and Norshahrul Idlan Talaha while Thailand's goals were scored by an Irfan Zakaria own goal and Pansa Hemviboon. Thailand were the first to draw blood when Malaysian goalkeeper Farizal Marlias' save from a Thitipan Puangchan header was accidentall...

item.title: Malaysia dump defending champs Thailand in semi-final - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia dump defending champs Thailand in semi-final  The Star Online

BANGKOK: Lady Luck was certainly smiling on Malaysia as the underdogs knocked out defending champions Thailand from the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-finals. Ten-man Harimau Malaya advanced to the final on away goal rule after holding the War Elephants to a 2-2 draw in a pulsating affair at the Rajamangala Stadium yesterday. In the first leg, both teams played to a goalless draw at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil last Saturday. The Thais looked to have sealed their berth in the final in the last minute after they were awarded a spot-kick. Syahmi Safari was penalised for a handball and was sent of...

item.title: Malaysia beat Thailand on away goals in Suzuki Cup semis - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia beat Thailand on away goals in Suzuki Cup semis  The Star Online

Malaysia is in the final of the AFF Suzuki Cup! Harimau Malaya, led by coach Tan Cheng Hoe, fought back to hold Thailand to a 2-2 draw in a pulsating affair at the Rajamangala Stadium in Bangkok on Dec 5 night. Malaysia were held 0-0 at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil on Dec 1.

item.title: Can we roar in Bangkok - The Star Online
item.description:
Can we roar in Bangkok  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The odds are stacked against Harimau Malaya as they face the daunting task of beating Thailand in the second leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final at the Rajamangala Stadium in Bangkok on Wednesday (Dec 5). Tan Cheng Hoe’s side drew 0-0 in the first-leg at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil on Saturday (Dec 1) but battled well against Thailand, who are fancied to win the coveted trophy. While Thailand has promised a “nightmarish” experience for Malaysia, Harimau Malaya is unperturbed by the threats and is only looking at maintaining their good momentum for the match. Malaysia...

item.title: AirAsia flies fans for semi-final match at discounted price Hats off to AirAsia - The Star Online
item.description:
AirAsia flies fans for semi-final match at discounted price Hats off to AirAsia  The Star Online

BANGKOK: The national football team had a massive morale boost in their crucial second leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final match against Thailand at the Rajamangala Stadium – thanks to AirAsia. The Harimau Malaya held the War Elephants to a goalless draw in the first leg at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil last Saturday. The airline had offered a special return ticket for RM349 to Bangkok to spur the team for the return match in Bangkok last night and a total of 160 Malaysian football fans including the Ultras Malaya quickly snapped up the offer. AirAsia Malaysia Chief Operating Officer...

item.title: Syahmi's screamer gives Malaysia half-time advantage - The Star Online
item.description:
Syahmi's screamer gives Malaysia half-time advantage  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Syahmi Safari's thunderbolt has given Malaysia an away goal advantage as they are currently holding Thailand 1-1 in the first half of the AFF Suzuki Cup second leg semi-final match in Bangkok. The Selangor right-back, who received the ball from Syamer Kutty Abba from the middle, drove forward and took a thunderous shot which went past the hapless Chathchai Budprom in the 27th minute. Thailand were the first to draw blood when Malaysian goalkeeper Farizal Marlias' save from a Thitipan Puangchan header was accidentally bundled into the Malaysian goal by substitute Irfan Zakaria...

item.title: Get ready for a nightmare in Bangkok, warns Thai keeper - The Star Online
item.description:
Get ready for a nightmare in Bangkok, warns Thai keeper  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Thailand goalkeeper Chatchai Budprom has promised to give the Harimau Malaya a nightmare in the second leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-finals at the Rajamangala Stadium in Bangkok tonight. Malaysia and Thailand played out a goalless draw in the first leg at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil last Saturday, which saw Tan Cheng Hoe’s men dominating the match with attacking tactics. The progression to the final is finely poised and Chatchai ramped up the mind games as the hosts look to progress to the final to defend their AFF Suzuki Cup crown. “I wish Malaysia a good sleep toni...

item.title: Harimau Malaya positive of getting good result in second leg - The Star Online
item.description:
Harimau Malaya positive of getting good result in second leg  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The Harimau Malaya are confident of gaining a good result in Bangkok and qualify for the final of the AFF Suzuki Cup. Midfielder Syamer Kutty Abba said if the players continue their upwards momentum in Bangkok for the second leg of the semi-final against Thailand at the Rajamangala Stadium tomorrow (8pm Malaysian time), there is a chance for an upset. The first leg at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil last Saturday ended in a goalless draw. “Thankfully, we did not concede any goals in the first leg. If we score there (Bangkok), it would be tough for Thailand. We have to tak...

item.title: Malaysia left to rue missed chances - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia left to rue missed chances  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: For all their dominance, Malaysia was sorely lacking a potent finisher. Harimau Malaya dominated possession, had superb pass accuracy and kept Thailand under pressure with 23 attempts on goals but forwards like Muhammad Safawi Rasid and Mahamadou Sumareh were guilty of missing several chances in the AFF Suzuki Cup first-leg semi-final against Thailand at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil on Saturday. Malaysia’s lack of a number nine striker was certainly telling as playmaker Norshahrul Idlan Talaha, wing-backs Muhammad Syahmi Safari and Muhammad Syazwan Andik Mohd Ishak cre...

item.title: Malaysia hold defending champs Thai to goalless draw - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia hold defending champs Thai to goalless draw  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia kept their unbeaten record against neighbours Thailand after holding the defending champions to a goalless draw in the first leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil. The Harimau Malaya have not lost to Thailand at home in 47 years and the Thais’ only win on the Malaysian soil was at the 1971 Merdeka Tournament where they won 2-0. While Malaysia kept their bragging rights with a spirited display yesterday, they will face an uphill battle in the second leg in Bangkok on Wednesday. National coach Tan Cheng Hoe was happy they did not co...

item.title: Get behind our team - The Star Online
item.description:
Get behind our team  The Star Online

IT REALLY hasn’t been the best few days for Malaysia, with the Sri Maha Mariamman temple issue in USJ dominating the headlines. The comments on social media have been sickening to say the least, with fake and unverified news apparently the order of the day. Without delving much into this issue, it has been depressing and the openly racist behaviour is truly sad. I can understand the anger but there is a way to heal the fractures. I can only propose one thing to all the racists and religionists (regardless of who they are) – please support our Harimau Malaya against Thailand this Saturday. I...

item.title: Cheng Hoe wants players to turn the screw on Thailand in Bangkok - The Star Online
item.description:
Cheng Hoe wants players to turn the screw on Thailand in Bangkok  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: “We will play with the same intensity and tempo in Rajamangala.” Those were the words of national coach Tan Cheng Hoe (pic), who has urged his charges to continue with their attacking verve but work on their composure in front of goal. Thailand were put under pressure in the first leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final against Malaysia on Saturday as the hosts were relentless in their pursuit for goals. However, Thailand stayed resolute to earn a 0-0 draw and Malaysia now face a mounting task in the second-leg at the Rajamangala Stadium in Bangkok on Wednesday. Cheng Hoe expres...

item.title: FAM: SEA Games football ticket sales are not our responsibility - The Star Online
item.description:
FAM: SEA Games football ticket sales are not our responsibility  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The Football Association of Malaysia (FAM) have clarified that they are not responsible for matters relating to the sale of tickets for SEA Games football and futsal matches. This includes the sale of tickets for Tuesday's crunch football final match between Malaysia and Thailand at the Shah Alam Stadium. FAM secretary-general Datuk Hamidin Mohd Amin said this came under the purview of the Malaysia Organizing Committee (Masoc) and the Youth & Sports Ministry. He added that the Football Malaysia Limited Liability Partnership (FMLLP) was also not responsible for the sale of tic...

item.title: Malaysia faces Indonesia in SEA Games football semi finals - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia faces Indonesia in SEA Games football semi finals  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Malaysia’s under-23 men’s team is set to face arch-nemesis Indonesia in a pivotal SEA games semi-finals football match that will kick off at Shah Alam Stadium on 8.45pm Saturday night. A victory for Harimau Malaya will guarantee Malaysia a spot in the final match which will be held on Aug 29 at the Bukit Jalil National Stadium. Malaysia advanced to the last four places after winning all four of their Group A matches, and Malaysia also holds a psychological advantage over Indonesia, having beaten them 3-0 in the 2018 Asian Federation Cup (AFC) Under-23 Championship qualifiers ...

item.title: Unlucky keeper not to blame as Kim Swee tells team to move on - The Star Online
item.description:
Unlucky keeper not to blame as Kim Swee tells team to move on  The Star Online

IT’S time to look forward and move on for the national Under-23 football team after missing out on the “mother of all gold medals” in the 2017 Kuala Lumpur SEA Games. Heavyweights Thailand underlined their supremacy in the biennial Games by picking up their third consecutive gold medal – defeating Malaysia 1-0 and breaking the hearts of more than 80,000 fans at the Shah Alam Stadium on Tuesday. All it took was a bizarre own goal by goalkeeper Mohamed Haziq Nadzli, who inexplicably punched the ball into his own net from midfielder Phitiwat Sookjitthummakul’s corner kick in the 38th minute. I...

item.title: Sathianathan ready to take a Giant step with Selangor - The Star Online
item.description:
Sathianathan ready to take a Giant step with Selangor  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The bar has been set for newly appointed Selangor head coach B. Sathianathan. The former Felda United coach has been tasked by the management to lead the Red Giants to a top-two finish in the Malaysia Super League next season. Calling Football Association of Selangor (FAS) president Tengku Amir Shah Sultan Sharafuddin Idris Shah ambitious and visionary, Sathianathan said he was attracted by the team’s long-term project to bring Selangor back to their glory days. “The Crown Prince of Selangor is serious about improving this team. He wants to rekindle the glory days of the Red ...

item.title: Plenty of action but no goals between Malaysia and Thailand - The Star Online
item.description:
Plenty of action but no goals between Malaysia and Thailand  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The boisterous atmosphere at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil certainly galvanised Harimau Malaya as they dominated the first half of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final against Thailand but could not convert them to goals. Malaysia had eight attempts at Thailand’s goal but most of the shots taken by the players were either wide or smothered by Thailand’s goalkeeper Chatchai Bootprom. The best chance of the game came in the 25th minute when Mahamadou Sumareh was put through by Mohamad Safawi Rasid’s pass but the winger’s shot brushed the left post of Thailand’s goal. Safawi and ...

item.title: M’sia must take charge against Myanmar, says Kim Swee - The Star Online
item.description:
M’sia must take charge against Myanmar, says Kim Swee  The Star Online

MALAYSIA football coach Datuk Ong Kim Swee has told his players “to take charge” of their match against leaders Myanmar in their SEA Games top-of-the-table Group A clash at the Shah Alam Stadium tonight. Myanmar top the group with nine points after three matches and are already through to the semi-finals. Malaysia are second with six points from two matches. Both teams are hoping to top the group to avoid meeting the Group B winners in the semi-finals. Three teams – Vietnam, Indonesia and Thailand – are vying to finish in the top two of Group B. Malaysia won their opening two matches with i...

item.title: Norshahrul and Zaquan deliver as Malaysia grab semis ticket - The Star Online
item.description:
Norshahrul and Zaquan deliver as Malaysia grab semis ticket  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia advanced to the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-finals in style with a 3-0 win over Myanmar in their final Group A match. Goals from old war horses Norshahrul Idlan Talaha (26th minute) and Zaquan Adha Abdul Razak (48th and 88th) handed the Harimau Malaya a comfortable win at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil last night. Malaysia finished second with nine points – behind group champions Vietnam who have 10 points after four matches – to book their berth in the final four. Malaysia coach Tan Cheng Hoe made three changes to his line-up from the previous match – a 0-2 loss to Viet...

item.title: JDT are invincible at Larkin Stadium, says winger Azamuddin - The Star Online
item.description:
JDT are invincible at Larkin Stadium, says winger Azamuddin  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Johor Darul Ta’zim (JDT) winger Azamuddin Akil is banking on home comfort to overcome Selangor in their Malaysia Cup final Group D match at the Larkin Stadium tonight. The outcome of this game will also determine their quarter-final opponents – either Group C winners and defending champions Kedah or runners-up Melaka. Super League champions JDT top the group with 10 points and are ahead of Selangor on goal difference. Third-placed Sarawak (4pts) and basement side Terengganu (3pts) are out of the running for the quarter-finals. The Southern Tigers are unbeaten in 39 matches at...

item.title: Quick and lethal - The Star Online
item.description:
Quick and lethal  The Star Online

TWO quick first-half goals were enough to set Malaysia on their way to a convincing 3-1 win over Myanmar in their penultimate Group A football match at the Shah Alam Stadium. Strikers N. Thanabalan struck in the 33rd minute before Safawi Rasid added the second in the 35th minute to give coach Datuk Ong Kim Swee’s men a comfortable 2-0 lead. Thanabalan added the third in the 82nd minute to kill off Myanmar, who tried to make a match of it with an 86th-minute goal by Than Paing. But it clearly proved to be too little, too late. Kim Swee was a happy man after the match, saying said his side ca...

item.title: Safawi: Scoring not important as long as the team win - The Star Online
item.description:
Safawi: Scoring not important as long as the team win  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Muhammad Safawi Rasid has only one thing in mind and that is to bring Malaysia to the semi-finals of the AFF Suzuki Cup. The Johor Darul Ta’zim (JDT) winger, who has yet to break his duck in the tournament, said that he is not overly concerned over his lack of goals but wants to help the team do well against Myanmar tomorrow in Bukit Jalil. “Maybe luck is not on my side (on scoring the goals). For the next game, I will try my best to score,” said Safawi. “If it does not happen, it’s okay, I’m not concerned about who is going to score against Myanmar. As a team, we just want to...

item.title: Football gold is ours, says Thai coach - The Star Online
item.description:
Football gold is ours, says Thai coach  The Star Online

SEPANG: Thailand football coach Woorawoot Srimaka is no stranger to Malaysian football. The 45-year-old former national striker knows all about the game here and is confident that Thailand can return home with the gold medal. As a player, Woorawoot scored seven goals in the 9-0 rout of Malaysia’s 2000 Olympic team in a friendly in Bangkok in 1998. “Yes, I know Malaysian football. The rivalry has always been there and we’re here to win the gold again,” said Woorawoot, who played for Kelantan in the Premier League 13 years ago. He said that although the Thai team were assembled just a week ag...

item.title: JDT to unleash their might for Malaysia Cup challenge - The Star Online
item.description:
JDT to unleash their might for Malaysia Cup challenge  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Johor Darul Ta’zim (JDT) will be staging a serious assault on the Malaysia Cup. The Southern Tigers have won a total of seven M-League titles – Super League (three), Charity Shield (two) and FA Cup (one)– since their formation in 2013. And they also won the second-tier AFC Cup in 2015. But they have never won the Malaysia Cup, the country’s most prestigious football tournament. With the Super League title virtually in the bag for the fourth year running, JDT head coach Ulisses Morais wants his men to end the anomaly. JDT have been struggling in the Malaysia Cup with one win i...

item.title: Malaysia in thorny situation after draw with Hong Kong - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia in thorny situation after draw with Hong Kong  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Malaysia’s hopes of qualifying for the 2019 Asian Cup Finals took a dent after they were held 1-1 by Hong Kong in their second Group B qualifying match at the Hang Jebat Stadium in Melaka. Last night, winger Mohd Syazwan Zainon and goalkeeper Hafizul Hakim Khairul Nizam Jothy saved the blushes for the nine-man Harimau Malaya in a hard fought battle. Syazwan scored the equaliser in the 56th minute after Hong Kong took the lead through striker Alessandro Leonardo in the 53rd minute, while Hafizul denied the visitors full points when he saved a late penalty. Malaysia remained bo...

item.title: Jafri hoping for starting spot after fine show - The Star Online
item.description:
Jafri hoping for starting spot after fine show  The Star Online

STRIKER Jafri Firdaus Chew rec­kons that his brace in the 3-1 win over Laos in their final Group A match will cement his place in the starting line-up. Jafri made the first XI in the opening 2-1 win over Brunei but failed to score and was dropped for the next match against Singapore which Malaysia won 2-1. On Monday, the Penang striker came off the bench and provided an assist for N. Thanabalan’s second goal in the 3-1 win over Myanmar. Two days later, Jafri finally found his scoring boots against Laos when he scored the opening goal in the 26th minute. And in the dying minutes of the match...

item.title: Safiq leads by example - The Star Online
item.description:
Safiq leads by example  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: Johor Darul Ta’zim (JDT) celebrated their fourth consecutive Super League title in style by trouncing Kelantan 3-0. Goals by defender S. Kunalan (19th minute), Argentinean midfielder Gonzalo Cabrera (36th) and captain Safiq Rahim (55th) at the Larkin Stadium last night ensured Johor remain unbeaten at home for the past five seasons. JDT, who wrapped up the league title with four matches to spare last month, should have taken an early lead when referee Razlan Joffri Ali awarded a penalty after Kelantan defender Mohd Qayyum Marjoni Sabil handled the ball in the box. Lebanese strik...

item.title: Davies eager to give Harimau Malaya a boost - The Star Online
item.description:
Davies eager to give Harimau Malaya a boost  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Defender Matthew Davies is looking forward to taking his good form from the national Under-23 squad to the senior team in their 2019 Asian Cup qualifiers Group B away match against Hong Kong on Oct 10. The Pahang skipper, who helped the Under-23 team win the silver medal at the Kuala Lumpur SEA Games last month, has received his second call-up under Portuguese coach Eduardo Vingada. He was dropped by Vingada after picking up a groin injury during the team’s centralised training in Johor Baru ahead of their Group B opener against Lebanon in June. Malaysia lost that match 2-1. ...

item.title: Vingada questions refereeing quality in draw with HK - The Star Online
item.description:
Vingada questions refereeing quality in draw with HK  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: National coach Eduardo Vingada (pic) has slam-med Australian referee Christopher Beath’s handling of the Asian Cup Group B qualifying match against Hong Kong. The clash at the Hang Jebat Stadium in Melaka on Tuesday ended in a 1-1 draw, leaving Malaysia last in the four-team group with just a point after two matches. Lebanon lead the group with the maximum six points while Hong Kong are second on two points from three matches. North Korea, with one point after one match, are third with a better goal difference. The 64-year-old Portuguese coach said that Beath’s unjust decisio...

item.title: SEA Games: Football fans camping out for tickets to final - The Star Online
item.description:
SEA Games: Football fans camping out for tickets to final  The Star Online

SHAH ALAM: Local football supporters flocked to the Melawati Stadium here as early as 10pm Sunday to grab their tickets to the men's football final between Malaysia and Thailand on Tuesday night. Thousands of supporters had formed long queues at ticket counters which only opened at 11am Monday, to ensure that they did not miss the chance to witness the match for the "mother of all medals" at the 2017 Kuala Lumpur SEA Games (KL2017). According to a statement from the KL2017 secretariat, tickets will not be sold online at the KL2017 website. Tickets for supporters of the home team are being s...

item.title: Malaysia qualifies for AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia qualifies for AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia sealed a spot in the knockout stages of the AFF Suzuki Cup after beating Myanmar 3-0 at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil on Saturday (Nov 24). The national team will now face the winners of Group B in a two-legged semi final. Malaysia drew first blood when Norshahrul Idlan Talaha prodded in a loose ball from Mahamadou Suamareh audacious scissor kick in the 20th minute. The Harimau Malaya piled on the misery for Myanmar when captain Mohd Zaquan Adha Abd Razak buried from the spot in the dying stages of the first half to give Malaysia a 2-0 lead. Malaysia completed t...
